channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Anchoring Path for Inductive Relation Prediction in Knowledge Graphs
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose Anchoring Path Sentence Transformer (APST) by introducing Anchoring Paths (APs) to alleviate the reliance of CPs.

item.title: Controllable 3D Face Generation with Conditional Style Code Diffusion
item.description: For 3D GAN inversion, we introduce two methods which aim to enhance the representation of style codes and alleviate 3D inconsistencies.

item.title: Fine-tuning Graph Neural Networks by Preserving Graph Generative Patterns
item.description: In this paper, we identify the fundamental cause of structural divergence as the discrepancy of generative patterns between the pre-training and downstream graphs.

item.title: TinySAM: Pushing the Envelope for Efficient Segment Anything Model
item.description: We first propose a full-stage knowledge distillation method with online hard prompt sampling strategy to distill a lightweight student model.

item.title: HW-V2W-Map: Hardware Vulnerability to Weakness Mapping Framework for Root Cause Analysis with GPT-assisted Mitigation Suggestion
item.description: The escalating complexity of modern computing frameworks has resulted in a surge in the cybersecurity vulnerabilities reported to the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) by practitioners.

item.title: LingoQA: Video Question Answering for Autonomous Driving
item.description: To fill this gap, we introduce LingoQA, a benchmark specifically for autonomous driving Video QA.

item.title: PhysRFANet: Physics-Guided Neural Network for Real-Time Prediction of Thermal Effect During Radiofrequency Ablation Treatment
item.description: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) is a widely used minimally invasive technique for ablating solid tumors.

item.title: Universal Noise Annotation: Unveiling the Impact of Noisy annotation on Object Detection
item.description: For object detection task with noisy labels, it is important to consider not only categorization noise, as in image classification, but also localization noise, missing annotations, and bogus bounding boxes.

item.title: Dual Attention U-Net with Feature Infusion: Pushing the Boundaries of Multiclass Defect Segmentation
item.description: The proposed architecture, Dual Attentive U-Net with Feature Infusion (DAU-FI Net), addresses challenges in semantic segmentation, particularly on multiclass imbalanced datasets with limited samples.

item.title: Revisiting Foreground and Background Separation in Weakly-supervised Temporal Action Localization: A Clustering-based Approach
item.description: It comprises two core components: a snippet clustering component that groups the snippets into multiple latent clusters and a cluster classification component that further classifies the cluster as foreground or background.

item.title: Entropic Open-set Active Learning
item.description: Active Learning (AL) aims to enhance the performance of deep models by selecting the most informative samples for annotation from a pool of unlabeled data.

item.title: SE(3)-Equivariant and Noise-Invariant 3D Motion Tracking in Medical Images
item.description: Here we propose EquiTrack, the first method that uses recent steerable SE(3)-equivariant CNNs (E-CNN) for motion tracking.

item.title: Structured Probabilistic Coding
item.description: By extracting compact and informative representations from input related to the target task, SPC can enhance the generalization ability of pre-trained language models for better language understanding.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation for Driving Scenes
item.description: Notably, the proposed method achieves 51. 8\% mIoU on the Cityscapes test dataset, showcasing its potential as a strong WSSS baseline on driving scene datasets.

item.title: Argue with Me Tersely: Towards Sentence-Level Counter-Argument Generation
item.description: The results show the competitiveness of our proposed framework and evaluator in counter-argument generation tasks.

item.title: Paint3D: Paint Anything 3D with Lighting-Less Texture Diffusion Models
item.description: This paper presents Paint3D, a novel coarse-to-fine generative framework that is capable of producing high-resolution, lighting-less, and diverse 2K UV texture maps for untextured 3D meshes conditioned on text or image inputs.

item.title: Upper Bounding Barlow Twins: A Novel Filter for Multi-Relational Clustering
item.description: To overcome this drawback, we propose to learn a graph filter motivated by the theoretical analysis of Barlow Twins.

item.title: HGE: Embedding Temporal Knowledge Graphs in a Product Space of Heterogeneous Geometric Subspaces
item.description: Temporal knowledge graphs may exhibit static temporal patterns at distinct points in time and dynamic temporal patterns between different timestamps.

item.title: Towards More Faithful Natural Language Explanation Using Multi-Level Contrastive Learning in VQA
item.description: To address the above issues, we propose a novel self-supervised \textbf{M}ulti-level \textbf{C}ontrastive \textbf{L}earning based natural language \textbf{E}xplanation model (MCLE) for VQA with semantic-level, image-level, and instance-level factual and counterfactual samples.

item.title: T-Eval: Evaluating the Tool Utilization Capability Step by Step
item.description: In contrast to previous works that evaluate models holistically, we comprehensively decompose the tool utilization into multiple sub-processes, including instruction following, planning, reasoning, retrieval, understanding, and review.

item.title: Neural Point Cloud Diffusion for Disentangled 3D Shape and Appearance Generation
item.description: However, none of the existing models enable disentangled generation to control the shape and appearance separately.

item.title: $\textit{V}^*$: Guided Visual Search as a Core Mechanism in Multimodal LLMs
item.description: However, the lack of this visual search mechanism in current multimodal LLMs (MLLMs) hinders their ability to focus on important visual details, especially when handling high-resolution and visually crowded images.

item.title: Bootstrap Masked Visual Modeling via Hard Patches Mining
item.description: To empower the model as a teacher, we propose Hard Patches Mining (HPM), predicting patch-wise losses and subsequently determining where to mask.

item.title: A Comprehensive End-to-End Computer Vision Framework for Restoration and Recognition of Low-Quality Engineering Drawings
item.description: Existing computer vision approaches for digitizing engineering drawings typically assume the input drawings have high quality.

item.title: Adapt & Align: Continual Learning with Generative Models Latent Space Alignment
item.description: In this work, we introduce Adapt & Align, a method for continual learning of neural networks by aligning latent representations in generative models.

item.title: Gaussian Splitting Algorithm with Color and Opacity Depended on Viewing Direction
item.description: To mitigate the caveats of both models, we propose a hybrid model that uses GS representation of the 3D object's shape and NeRF-based encoding of color and opacity.

item.title: A Semantic Space is Worth 256 Language Descriptions: Make Stronger Segmentation Models with Descriptive Properties
item.description: Instead of relying solely on category-specific annotations, ProLab uses descriptive properties grounded in common sense knowledge for supervising segmentation models.

item.title: ChatGPT as a commenter to the news: can LLMs generate human-like opinions?
item.description: ChatGPT, GPT-3. 5, and other large language models (LLMs) have drawn significant attention since their release, and the abilities of these models have been investigated for a wide variety of tasks.

item.title: SPGroup3D: Superpoint Grouping Network for Indoor 3D Object Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel superpoint grouping network for indoor anchor-free one-stage 3D object detection.

item.title: DriveLM: Driving with Graph Visual Question Answering
item.description: The experiments demonstrate that Graph VQA provides a simple, principled framework for reasoning about a driving scene, and DriveLM-Data provides a challenging benchmark for this task.

item.title: Leveraging Visual Supervision for Array-based Active Speaker Detection and Localization
item.description: The multichannel audio ``student'' network is trained to generate the same results.

item.title: 3D Pose Estimation of Two Interacting Hands from a Monocular Event Camera
item.description: 3D hand tracking from a monocular video is a very challenging problem due to hand interactions, occlusions, left-right hand ambiguity, and fast motion.

item.title: MFABA: A More Faithful and Accelerated Boundary-based Attribution Method for Deep Neural Networks
item.description: To better understand the output of deep neural networks (DNN), attribution based methods have been an important approach for model interpretability, which assign a score for each input dimension to indicate its importance towards the model outcome.

item.title: Risk-Sensitive Stochastic Optimal Control as Rao-Blackwellized Markovian Score Climbing
item.description: Stochastic optimal control of dynamical systems is a crucial challenge in sequential decision-making.

item.title: HD-Painter: High-Resolution and Prompt-Faithful Text-Guided Image Inpainting with Diffusion Models
item.description: Recent progress in text-guided image inpainting, based on the unprecedented success of text-to-image diffusion models, has led to exceptionally realistic and visually plausible results.

item.title: TagCLIP: A Local-to-Global Framework to Enhance Open-Vocabulary Multi-Label Classification of CLIP Without Training
item.description: As a result, we dissect the preservation of patch-wise spatial information in CLIP and proposed a local-to-global framework to obtain image tags.

item.title: NodeMixup: Tackling Under-Reaching for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: However, due to the uneven location distribution of labeled nodes in the graph, labeled nodes are only accessible to a small portion of unlabeled nodes, leading to the \emph{under-reaching} issue.

item.title: Fed-QSSL: A Framework for Personalized Federated Learning under Bitwidth and Data Heterogeneity
item.description: Motivated by high resource costs of centralized machine learning schemes as well as data privacy concerns, federated learning (FL) emerged as an efficient alternative that relies on aggregating locally trained models rather than collecting clients' potentially private data.

item.title: Spectral Prompt Tuning:Unveiling Unseen Classes for Zero-Shot Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Recently, CLIP has found practical utility in the domain of pixel-level zero-shot segmentation tasks.

item.title: AutoXPCR: Automated Multi-Objective Model Selection for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Our method clearly outperforms other model selection approaches - on average, it only requires 20% of computation costs for recommending models with 90% of the best-possible quality.

item.title: Federated Learning with Extremely Noisy Clients via Negative Distillation
item.description: The model trained on noisy labels serves as a `bad teacher' in knowledge distillation, aiming to decrease the risk of providing incorrect information.

item.title: AdvST: Revisiting Data Augmentations for Single Domain Generalization
item.description: Then, we propose Adversarial learning with Semantics Transformations (AdvST) that augments the source domain data with semantics transformations and learns a robust model with the augmented data.

item.title: Zero-1-to-3: Domain-level Zero-shot Cognitive Diagnosis via One Batch of Early-bird Students towards Three Diagnostic Objectives
item.description: Consequently, we refine the cognitive states of cold-start students as diagnostic outcomes via virtual data, aligning with the diagnosis-oriented goal.

item.title: MinePlanner: A Benchmark for Long-Horizon Planning in Large Minecraft Worlds
item.description: We propose a new benchmark for planning tasks based on the Minecraft game.

item.title: Reducing Shape-Radiance Ambiguity in Radiance Fields with a Closed-Form Color Estimation Method
item.description: The key is a rendering method that is only based on the density field.

item.title: Machine Mindset: An MBTI Exploration of Large Language Models
item.description: We present a novel approach for integrating Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) personality traits into large language models (LLMs), addressing the challenges of personality consistency in personalized AI.

item.title: Realistic Rainy Weather Simulation for LiDARs in CARLA Simulator
item.description: To this end, we propose a simulator-based physical modeling approach to augment LiDAR data in rainy weather in order to improve the perception performance of LiDAR in this scenario.

item.title: Turning English-centric LLMs Into Polyglots: How Much Multilinguality Is Needed?
item.description: The vast majority of today's large language models are English-centric, having been pretrained predominantly on English text.

item.title: Performance rating in chess, tennis, and other contexts
item.description: The main theorem establishes that the PR$^e$ of a player is equivalent to the TPR whenever the latter is defined.

item.title: Fine-tuning Large Language Models for Adaptive Machine Translation
item.description: These findings emphasise the significance of fine-tuning efficient LLMs like Mistral 7B to yield high-quality zero-shot translations comparable to task-oriented models like NLLB 3. 3B.
